Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Boutique Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Mer57maid
Reviews.Content: On our second trip to Paris, we wanted to stay in the Latin Quarter. After 10 days at this hotel, we would recommend Relais Saint Jacques for couples wanting an intimate experience at a reasonble price with friendly, personal service! The 24-hour front desk staff was very professional and always helpful. The rooms are small, but elegant and well-equipped. Yes, there is a blow dryer and pants press (no iron). The twin beds are a little narrow, but with great pillows and linens. We sleep on memory foam at home, but found these beds very comfortable by European standards. The bathroom is also small, but the full shower was excellent...great water pressure; never ran out of hot water! The fluffy towels plus robes and slippers are a nice touch as well. Only a few rooms have balconies, but this upgrade is worth every penny if available! (We contacted the hotel directly to arrange for this...it made the room seem larger.) Fantastic location, close to everything, but on a relatively quiet street. Also loved that it was within walking distance of Notre Dame, several shops, restaurants and only a couple of blocks from the Luxembourg RER and Metro station. Didn't have breakfast at the hotel; too many other options close by. Walk straight out the front door up Rue Gay Lussac for some wonderful bakeries and restaurants. The Sorbonne square and Pantheon are close as well. Note: As with many European hotels, your room key controls the electricity. When you are not in the room, the electricity is OFF. If you have electronic devices to charge, they will only do so when you are in the room with your key. We highly recommend this property and would definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Good location and Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: Like2Travell
Reviews.Content: This is a good option for a city stay close to both the Latin Quarter and Saint Germain. Found it after reading a lot of reviews and chose it mainly because of price and location. The hotel offered a good price promotion which was better than third-party websites like Booking.com. Our room was typical - small but clean and the bathroom was a good size with a good shower and all the ammenities. The room has all the basics, safe, hair dryer, cable tv, etc. (although was dissappointed to only find one english channel). The hotel booked Moulin Rouge tickets for us and overall they were very friendly and helpful regarding restaurant and transportation suggestions. Would highly recommend this hotel especially if you book a slightly bigger room since it has good dining option within a 15 min walk and is located on a small quiet street which seems to be surrounded by universities, offices and residences.

Reviews.Title: “Anniversary celebration”
Reviews.Author: James B
Reviews.Content: The hotel was all we expected of a four star hotel. The location is great. The rate commensurate with the quality. The friendly, helpful support of the front desk staff contributed significantly to the wonderful time my wife and I spent celebrating our golden wedding anniversary in Paris. MM Ellisa's recommendation for dining at the Bouillon Racine on our anniversary was perfect—and her assistance in facilitating our son and daughter’s surprise gift of champagne (even iced), flowers and chocolates was certainly appreciated.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel, Great Location, Small Room”
Reviews.Author: Wino35
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Repaid Saint-Jacques has so many things going for it: -Lovely property -Excellent service -Quiet location on a tree-lined street, just a few minutes walk from the RER at Luxumbourg, and five minutes walk from the bars, restaurants, outdoor markets, and wine shops of the Latin Quarter. -Well appointed rooms What the Hotel does not have is an excess of space in its rooms. They're small. I have to admit to being disappointed when we entered. Maybe because everything else is so perfect. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay because it's got so much going for it. However, it's not cheap and I generally like a larger room.

Reviews.Title: “Just Great”
Reviews.Author: Clayton_3187
Reviews.Content: This hotel is just fantastic, from the staff, to the location, to the rooms. Located approx. 150m from Luxemborg Metro getting to the centre of Paris is easy. Good restaurants, bars, cafes surround the hotel and with no traffic noise getting a great night sleep is easy. Rooms easily fitted two adults with two good size suitcases with space to spare. I booked via the hotel website which was they best rate. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A quiet gem tucked near the Luxembourg”
Reviews.Author: katiedid123
Reviews.Content: This small boutique hotel was quite comfortable and conveniently located in the 5th arrondissement, just a short walking distance from all there is to see in the Latin Quarter. Tucked onto a quiet side street, the Relais Saint-Jacques has a small, quaint reception area where you can have a drink and a bright breakfast room. The staff is quite helpful and friendly. A nice find in Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Nice and cozy”
Reviews.Author: Pharaonics
Reviews.Content: Set in a quiet area with freshly refurbished rooms, this is a nice spot for spending a weekend in Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Paris Retreat”
Reviews.Author: julesher
Reviews.Content: You know the saying: ‘There are three things that matter in property: location, location, location". Well, this hotel is located in a great spot, close enough to every major Paris attraction, yet conveniently away from them in a nice and quiet neighborhood. For Paris first timers, it is ideal since it is located just a couple of blocks away from the Gare du Luxembourg (Paris RER) station, so you can get virtually anywhere in less than 30 minutes. The rooms are nice. Clean. Cozy and very well equipped. Unless you want to pay 800 Euros for a suite in a 5 stars hotel, this is a great option. The staff is very good, attentive and ready to help in anything you may need. Just need to ask. They all speak English. Some of them, even Spanish. We never tried their breakfast. But it looked very good ;) No fitness center. Not restaurant. Which anyway are not deal breakers since walking Paris is already a great workout and eating out is a must if you really want to enjoy the city.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: KatyL
Reviews.Content: Perfect location with Luxembourg RER right on the doorstep making it very easy to get around the city plus just 40 minute direct train ride from CDG airport. Lovely neighbourhood, much nicer than other parts of Paris, it felt clean and safe with plenty of cafes, great restaurants (recommend les papilles and la vin qui dance), patisseries etc but not too touristy. Hotel was very comfortable, excellent room sizes, nice bed, all very clean. Only bug bear was the shower didn't stay a constant temperature and wasn't very powerful. Not very appealing when you've had a long day walking round Paris! Also wifi would have been great along with more international tv channels but then I guess it is only a small hotel (22 rooms). Excellent reception staff and nice decor downstairs. Very good value for Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Strongly recommend!”
Reviews.Author: Mikhail Z
Reviews.Content: We had such a great time! Beautiful place! Strongly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place with great staff !”
Reviews.Author: Anders H
Reviews.Content: The hotell is located near Notre Dame. And close to a Metro station. The staff on the hotell was very nice, they speak english and are very helpful. They are ther 24/7, and the breakfast was very good. A litle and cosy room. Clean and nice. Got cleaned every day, and the bathroom was filled up with shampoo, soap, body lotion and bath robes and slippers. Very nice.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: New York, New York, United States
Reviews.Title: “Loved my stay”
Reviews.Author: Dan C
Reviews.Content: I was here for a week and a half on a business trip and loved staying at this hotel. Every night I was greeted warmly, the rooms were clean, and every member of the staff that I ran into was very friendly. If I return to Paris I will definitely be staying at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “A well chosen 2nd visit!”
Reviews.Author: swanseabaygirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel 2 years ago and had a really enjoyable stay. As it was a 'big' birthday for my husband last year, we did look for alternative hotels but couldn't find anything to match the location and value for money at the Relais Saint Jacques. We stayed Dec 2-6th 2011. We booked a superior / deluxe room and whilst compact (particulalrly the bathroom) everything was clean and in good working order and the bed was very comfortable. Mini bar and flat screen TV (supposed to have been a trouser press but there was just an indentation on the wall where this should have been), bath/shower, toilet and hairdyer, tea and coffee making facilities. We also had a blacony which would be fabulous in milder months. i believe the hotel had changed ownership relatively recently and the public areas were in the process of being redecorated and we weren't able to access the small bar for a nightcap - however, the decor looked really nice! We booked room only this time and it was a refreshing choice as we got up when we felt like without having to meet designated times - there were loads of bakeries and coffee shops nearby. Great location - we walked everywhere and were happily exhausted at the end of our 5 day stay. Very helpful and pleasant reception staff always willing to assist. We'd definitely return again. As it was a special occasion, I booked a private transfer from the airport to hotel and vice versa. However, next time we will definitely use the RER as it is so close. If you are looking for a good restaurant (not cheap but good food and excellent range of Belgian beers!) try La Gueuze. Great atmosphere and buzzing on a saturday night! Good range of provincial fayre too!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ava d d
Reviews.Content: Hotel Le Relais Saint Jacques is a perfect location for Latin Quarter and Saint Germain. It is on a quiet but beautiful street, an easy walk to Mouffetard street, Luxembourg gardens and St Germain area. We had a great stay here : nice room very well appointed and clean, excellent staff and Perfect location to discover the authentic Paris.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Service Ever !”
Reviews.Author: Tom_bosch388
Reviews.Content: What sets Relais Saint Jacques apart is the way the staff takes care of you all the time. I has nothing to do with any other hotel we've been to, Other hotels really have something to learn from the hospitality skills the employees possess at Relais Saint Jacques ! Our room was beautiful and the special treats made the whole experience an unforgettable one ! When we return to Paris, we will return to Relais Saint Jacques

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in the perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Brian B
Reviews.Content: We spent only a few nights at the Relais Sainte-Jacques, but loved every minute of it. The week before our arrival, I reached out to the staff for help with dinner reservations. No problem. We received professional confirmation emails back for every booking. I must mention Carlos, especially, who took care of everything we needed. I emailed ahead for guidance on the best way to get to the hotel from CDG, and received detailed emails right away. We consulted him repeatedly during our stay on every conceivable detail, and he nailed every request. The hotel is in the best part of the Latin Quarter... close to the Park but away from the gaggle of tourist crowds. You can walk everywhere, and we did. I'll be returning to Paris again soon, and I'll definitely stay at the RSJ again.

Reviews.Title: “The good and the bad”
Reviews.Author: tig66
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel by Paris standards but as you expect small rooms and tiny cupboard sized bathrooms. Towels in the bathroom were not clean when we arrived and the plug in the sink didnt work . The hairdryer was fixed so high on the wall that some people would struggle to use it. Staff were attentive and helpful when asked . You are a little way from the metro- the nearest is Luxemborg and I think that we were a little off the main area really. Not the best location probably if this is your first visit to the city . Overall this is a nice hotel but I dont think that it warrants a ' fabulous' rating .Hotels with this star rating should be better than average and this wasnt unfortunately.

Reviews.Title: “excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: girschek
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a stay at this hotel, we were three couples travelling from New England. The staff at this hotel was superb Elisa was the most helpful, friendly and professional person. We can't say enough about her she took care of our every need in no time at all. The rooms were comfortable a bit small and for one couple their shower didn't work and she changed their room. All in all the hotel was nice and the staff made it even better. Location was great and they gave wonderful directions. Would recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Bite size 5 star”
Reviews.Author: grazmulcahy
Reviews.Content: This place is rad. I booked it on a wim because I had messed up a different booking and needed a place last minute. I would stay here again no question. Itsbkind of your normal small Parisian hotelnbut done in a 5 star way. All thebextra little things. Like free voss water in room, good coffee in the morning etc and super friendly staff. Paris hotels are tough, on a world scale I wouldnt say that worth the 250 a night but in paris it's totally a winner. Good hotel done well and the staff are onto it. And great with English and generally helping you with whatever

Reviews.Title: “lovely boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: skeptictraveler
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel after having a dismal experience at another hotel nearby. The Saint-Jacques is small, elegant, and friendly. The staff, particularly the concierges, were wonderful. The room was comfortable, reasonably priced. The location is decent but not special. (Good for exercise, though.) The Relais is on a small street leading off the Rue Gay Lussac, which is near the Luxembourg Gardens but is not an interesting or beautiful street. Still, it was easy for us to hop on a bus or walk to where we wanted to go, and there is a wonderful restaurant within a couple of blocks called Les Papilles, where we had some of the best meals we ate in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Paris Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: PaulW305
Reviews.Content: We arrived at Hotel Relais the first night of our honeymoon to Paris. It was perfect! My wife and I were both really hoping for a sweet boutique hotel to spend one romantic evening and this more than fit the bill. The hotel is small in the best way and centrally located. The staff is very friendly, generous and accommodating. I called the day before to have them place a bottle of champagne and some flowers in the room and they handled it with ease adding also some chocolates. They also set us up with a perfect little room with sweet balcony. My wife really couldn't believe how beautiful it was. She was over the moon and our honeymoon in paris was off to an amazing start. Thank you, Hotel Relais, for making it such a special evening. We highly recommend Hotel Relais for your next trip to Paris!!

Reviews.Title: “A gem in the Latin Quarter”
Reviews.Author: michael l
Reviews.Content: On our first trip to Paris, we spotted this lovely property, but unfortunately, we had already booked a stay at a nearby hotel. We knew we had to come back and stay at the St Jacques. This was actually our second stay here (we loved it so much the first time). All of our needs were taken care of and the staff was very helpful in every way. Everyone spoke English and did their best to make our Paris stay enjoyable. Room was nicely decorated and the bathroom was spotless and linens were freshened daily. Another bonus was having a safe in the room along with a mini fridge. Breakfast was more than adequate to get one started each day, and at 17 euros each if you can get it included in the room price, it is a bargain. The breakfast room and lobby sitting area is charming. Location is near Luxembourgh gardens and the Luxembourgh Metro stop on the blue line. Also, the #27 and 21 buses stop just 50 meters from the hotel. The 21 goes right by the Louvre. You can also ride the 82 bus to the Eiffel Tower, stop is at the Lux. Gardens. This was our 2nd stay at the Relais St. Jacques and we will stay again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “great location if you want the real paris”
Reviews.Author: Cn-three
Reviews.Content: We have been to paris many times in the last 16 years but never quite found the hotel to return to untill now. This hetel was in a great location for exploring any part of paris. We walked everywhere but the station that has the direct line to the airport is only 5 mins away so really handy. The rooms are not huge but unless you are prepared to pay many many hundreds of pounds no rooms are. But this room was more than fine, with good storage and real atmosphere. The only improvement I would suggest would be igger and fluffier towels, although the slippers and robe were a nice touch. Too warm to use them tho!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing...”
Reviews.Author: Criquette06
Reviews.Content: This hotel is fabulous because of its geographical location, quality of service and cleanliness of the rooms. Everything is designed in this magical place that you feel comfortable. A charming hotel in a romantic city, what more... I will return and would recommend this hotel to refined decoration.

Reviews.Title: “We enjoyed our stay in the hotel. The team provides an exellent service.”
Reviews.Author: RBrody
Reviews.Content: This nice and warm hotel with it's good team makes you feel at home.

Reviews.Title: “We loved everything about it !”
Reviews.Author: jr64_11
Reviews.Content: When it was 98 degrees F in Paris, our comfortable, air-conditioned room was our escape, and although we looked out on the busy street, we did not hear a sound in our room. We discovered that while the closest Metro station was blocks away, a very convenient bus line took us right to the heart of the city. The location is great for some very interesting shopping (Rue Mouffetard), and there are so many restaurants to choose from within a short walk (inlcluding one right next door). We found the staff to be very helpful and friendly. The buffet breakfast is cheerful and a good value. We have found "our place" in Paris and look forward to a return visit soon.

Reviews.Title: “OK stay which would have been much better but for the reception”
Reviews.Author: Marya82
Reviews.Content: We had a great room with fantastic views over Paris. The service at the reception is a bit of a problem, it was good on the day we arrived (the 11th of July) but terrible when we were leaving (July the 12th): she failed to order a taxi which we required and did not even bother to put the invoice into an envelope.

Reviews.Title: “Thank you for a lovely stay!”
Reviews.Author: sandypp
Reviews.Content: Quiet, comfortable room, the view out the window balcony was so sweet! Clean bathrooms. Quaint, tree lined street. Great cafe nearby for breakfast, lunch and dinner. Great location. Would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “OK and overpriced”
Reviews.Author: Wonderfulworld2009
Reviews.Content: We stayed in these hotel because the hotel we were staying previously ( Renaissance Paris Vendome), which was amazing, was fully booked. This hotel is not totally bad but also had nothing great that makes me want to go back. Maybe because we just came from the Renaissance and it was impossible not to compare but I found this hotel really overpriced for what it offered. We stayed at the deluxe room which was ok, a little old, and had a little balcony facing the street , must be nice in summer time but we went in winter so we didn't enjoy. What was really bad was the size of the bathroom. You had to squeeze yourself inside to be able to close the door and it almost hit the toilet. Let's put this way, I have never stayed in a place with such small bathroom. I guess it was slightly bigger than a bathroom of a cruise ship. Breakfast was good, not great. The only way I would think about going back was if the price was a bargain and even in that case I would think twice.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced”
Reviews.Author: Zografiotis
Reviews.Content: Stayed in April 2011. The staff were nice, we asked for a room at the back, as the hotel is near a reasonably busy road, and we got it. The room was indeed peaceful and clean albeit small with free wifi. The surrounding area is nice, with the Luxembourg gardens and the latin quarter nearby. All in all a reasonable hotel but pricey for what it is.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: Julie S
Reviews.Content: Very nice rooms, very well located in the Latin Quarter, verty good service from the staff who were all extemely polite and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: FMG10
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at this hotel for the third time and had another great stay. We went for a "significant birthday" treat for a few days and had a package inclusive of breakfast which was very good value.The hotel is small but elegant and the rooms are very clean and comfortable. It has it's own bar and breakfast room but no restaurant. Room service is available though from a local brasserie. On the two previous occasions we have taken our 2 young children and stayed in adjoining rooms which were excellent. The staff are really friendly and helpful. The hotel is in a great location on the Left Bank and the top of the Pantheon could be seen from the bedroom windows. The hotel is within suitcase carrying distance of the Luxembourg RER and walking distance of Notre Dame and Avenue St Germain. There are many good restaurants close by, check out on restaurant websites before you leave. We took the children to the Jardin de Plantes with its museums and Zoo, again within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, comfortable and helpful”
Reviews.Author: feelthefear
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in Paris often, always somewhere new. This hotel is ideally placed close to Luxembourg RER, the Luxembourg Gardens, St Germain and best of all the Sorbonne, the Pantheon and the heart of the 5th. with its shops, bars and restaurants. Our room had a balcony with Pantheon view, as requested, and was worth the extra. Good size room for Paris hotels and very quiet, at weekend. Good restaurant next door if you don't want to walk too far. Also nice little café/juice bar on St Michel beside Lux RER station. On checking out, we were asked what our travel arrangements were and were then informed that the RER to CdG was closed at Aulnay. The guy went to some lengths to help sort out alternatives, and we ended up getting a bus 100m from hotel to Opéra and then Roissybus direct to Terminal 2B. Excellent and easy. If you haven't spent time in this area , do make the effort. Strolling around Rue Mouffetard is a treat, particularly if you are lucky with the weather, as we were.

Reviews.Title: “Rejunvenating”
Reviews.Author: SuzannePennington_NJ
Reviews.Content: I returned to this hotel which was far more basic when I stayed here in 1970 as a student!! I brought my daughter who is the same age (21) as I was then. New leaves were appearing on the trees outside out window, a church bell chimed the hour. The room was comfortable and immaculate. The staff were delightful. The double glazed windows effectively blocked the street noise of the whizzing Vespas, but could be thrown open to the pleasant morning sounds of school children and University students bustling by. The attractive lounge provided guide books and comfortable chairs. We were grateful for the free wifi in our room. The metro was a short walk away, and we chose to head out every morning rather than eat breakfast in, so as not to waste a minute of our stretch of spring weather. For me, the chance to show my daughter the neighborhood where I had been a student was priceless.

Reviews.Title: “Great overall package for our honeymoon - nice room, location and wonderful staff!”
Reviews.Author: runner_diver
Reviews.Content: The location was perfect for us, 2 blocks from RER but which requires connecting to Metro, and walking distance to St Germain and the Latin Quarter areas for dining and shopping. The staff members were all very helpful, polite and service oriented. We enjoyed and used the balcony which was a plus.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: TravellerOlga
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel from 19 to 23 February. The location is very good, advantageous: on the one hand near the Metro, the tourist attraction and on the other hand it is situated on the calm street. The rooms of the hotel are comfortable, clean, equipped with everything what you need during your stay. And I want to say some words about the staff: responsive, well-wishing and try to help in your request. When we go to Paris in the next time we'll return to this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Cozy”
Reviews.Author: Renatoferraro
Reviews.Content: I'm often at the Relais St Jacques with my wife. We are a very old marriage (my wife's eyes are treated in Paris) and we feel here really at home, because of the kindness of the personnel!

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, Lovely Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: FromageVin
Reviews.Content: Le Relais Saint Jacques is a fabulous little boutique hotel in a beautiful/quiet/residential/academic part of the Latin Quarter. The staff were so helpful and friendly. The room, while small by American standards, is very tasteful and perfect for those not spending a lot of time in their room. It's Paris, why would you? Unlike some of the more major, name brand, upscale hotels, they provide FREE wireless internet service and water. I really appreciate this. As a New Yorker and accustomed to walking a great deal, it is a 10 - 15 minute walk to Le Metro and a 6 minute walk to the RER. The major sites are at least a half hour travel distance away (walking and metro) and this is reflected in the price. I really enjoyed my time here and would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “magnifique”
Reviews.Author: Vlad2011
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay at this hotel. I found the hotel personnel very professional, friendly and helpful. They made me feel at home. Besides, the hotel is conveniently located in a very charming area of Paris, near the Luxembourg Palace, within walking distance to Notrre Dame, the Louvre, the Seine river, etc... the subway/train station and many other services.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: TCU_2003
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the Paris leg of our honeymoon on the recommendation of a friend, and we loved it! We got a great rate on the room (advertised at their website online - not sure if bookings were down or not, but we traveled in July, which is still tourist season), and even got upgraded to a better room when we arrived. The bed was so comfortable, and we never had an issue with traffic noise. It's near the Luxembourg Gardens and the Pantheon, and an easy walk to the Metro. I loved that the hotel had free internet, and the staff spoke English and were very helpful. They also called a cab for us when we wanted to travel by cab. We'd definitely stay here again and recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Don't be misled by pictures and location”
Reviews.Author: letranger_10
Reviews.Content: Even though it says it is near Saint Germain, it is quite far to walk, and there's no metro or taxi stand nearnby. Location is quite inconvenienet. General attitude of the staff is, "There is nothing we can do."

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, if a bit overpriced”
Reviews.Author: Jacobmyoung
Reviews.Content: Happy to see a 2-for-1 breakfast special, but truthfully, this was a bit expensive for what we got. I made the mistake of thinking that the 400euro price was for three nights and not two, and by the time I realized it, they were going to charge me for one night's stay. So it was great, but sort of broke the bank. Also, Internet worked only ok, as it continually cuts out. So it is hard to download a movie, for example.

Reviews.Title: “Great service...overpriced rooms.”
Reviews.Author: CharleyToronto
Reviews.Content: I feel a little guilty writing a negative review on this hotel because the staff were so exceptionally friendly and willing to assist. It was the room...it was not worth $350.00. I have stayed in the teeniest tiniest little rooms in Paris and have been completely comfortable...but at $100 - $150 a night, not $350.00. It was clean and the location is nice with Luxembourg just around the corner.

Reviews.Title: “Delighted with choice, thanks TripAdvisor reviews”
Reviews.Author: LongIsland_NYMom
Reviews.Content: We chose Relais Saint-Jacques based on other TripAdvisor reviews. Thank you, reviewers, you were right on the mark! My husband, two teenagers, and I loved this clean, quiet hotel, a quick walk to the Ile de la Cite for history and Boulevard St. Michel for shopping. Our rates were extremely reasonable for the height of the tourist season, and the staff was absolutely lovely, which is the first time I can say this about a French hotel. The decor is just a little bit on the tired side, and the rooms are small (but if you're from NYC you'll think they are completely normal). Nevertheless, the hotel was better equipped than the fancy chain hotel we visited in Germany just before coming to Paris. We appreciated the Molton Brown toiletries, free WiFi, coffee maker, flat screen TV, linen wallpaper, roomy drawers, extra mirrors, and wall-mounted pants press(!). The air conditioning was actually strong, unlike any I've experienced in Europe, and the so was the blowdryer. The hotel has a quaint sitting-room with a library of cast-offs from other travelers. Again, we really liked the staff, who were soft-spoken and respectful, on-site even in the wee hours when we left for the airport, and kind enough to give us directions, recommend shops, call us a taxi, and lend us adapters when ours didn't work. The breakfast attendant was charming and patiently allowed my son to practice his middle-school French on her. We would stay there again in a heartbeat. Thumbs up!!!

Reviews.Title: “The staff was super friendly and helpful...”
Reviews.Author: Saintgermais
Reviews.Content: The staff was super friendly and helpful. The room was clean and very calm at night. The location is good, next to the metro station luxembourg.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 4 star”
Reviews.Author: GammelMont
Reviews.Content: I read nice reviews about this hotel and was looking forward to a lovely stay in Paris in a quaint hotel. I did have a nice time but really this place isn't a 4 star, maybe a well kept 3 star but no more. The service is good and with a smile but the rooms are tiny and my view was of a painted wall, just incredible. For over USD 280, i expected a bit more. Next time i'll stick to the big chains I know or a real 4 star. Location is great, next to Luxembourg on the B line that goes straight to the airport and there are many restaurants and shops around.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel off the Boulevard Saint-Michel”
Reviews.Author: LauraRW
Reviews.Content: This was one of the nicest hotels I stayed in in Paris, and as an added bonus they had a very good breakfast included in the room rate. The rooms were clean, and up to date. It was a very quiet neighborhood, so we were always able to get to sleep. (nice beds, too!!) It was an easy walk up Boul St. Mich to get to the Seine and everywhere we wanted to go. The breakfast room has one wall made of stone, and skylights, and the staff are very attentive. We asked for hot chocolate for my son, and even though that was not on offer, they provided it for him free of charge and it appeared every subsequent morning. My only tiny quibble with this hotel is the lights in the hallways. They are motion sensitive, I guess, and on a timer. We had three rooms between six people, and sometimes the lights would shut off before everyone could get into their room. Although my husband is fluent in French, the staff spoke perfect English to those members of our party who weren't, and were able to help us with travel info on Paris. A really lovely place.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, location and quality.”
Reviews.Author: graemew81
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Relais Saint Jacques for a week and had a wonderful stay. The staff were excellent, very helpful, courteous and friendly. They spoke english and helped with directions, places to see, where to eat etc. Rooms were very clean and although small to North American standards they had all the amenities you would expect at any 4 star hotel. Breakfast was included. I would highly recommend this hotel. It is only a 10 minute walk to the Latin Quarter and 5 minutes to the Luxembourg Gardens.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, gracious service, great location”
Reviews.Author: PeggyB3719
Reviews.Content: We splurged on a 4 star for our first night in Paris, and this hotel was well worth it. The service was elegant, the rooms large for Europe, and the concierges very helpful. Walking distance to the Luxembourg Gardens (wonderful) and to the Sorbonne and Louvre. We had a terrific dinner at a restaurant recommended by the concierge, Bouillon Racine ... ask for a table on the 2nd level (which they call the first floor). Hotel neighborhood was quiet and tree-lined.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Sconny
Reviews.Content: I love everything about this hotel. It is in a great location, on a quiet street, the rooms are charming, the beds are extremely comfortable. There is a very nice breakfast with good coffee. Best of all, the staff is extraordinarily helpful and friendly. What I particularly enjoyed, aside from the exceptional service generally, was the willingness of the staff to indulge me in my trying to speak French, even with my high school French, while it was obvious that they speak English much better than I speak French. I do not know when I will be in Paris again, but this will certainly be my first choice for a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Top hotel Paris”
Reviews.Author: bramu
Reviews.Content: Nice rooms with all the facilities. Perfect location in Saint Germain des Prés: near Notre Dame Cathedral, Luxembourg garden, The Pantheon and Montparnasse

Reviews.Title: “Cute little Gem”
Reviews.Author: RodolfoRio
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Relais St Jacques for 2 days adn was happy with my comfotable room, location close to RER Luxembourg and nice service. Free Wifi

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, good location, warm feeling...”
Reviews.Author: andreaRome
Reviews.Content: Facilities at walking distance and kindness of personnel made the stay at this hotel very confortable. It is not noisy and the quality of room was excellent. Pricing (medium high)in line with the offer in that area.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Angela22Durham
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel in March on a trip to Paris to watch the France/England rugby match. My daughter who is working in France was meeting me in Paris but had problems getting a hotel room. The hotel receptionist went to great lengths to try to find a room for her, to no avail. They then offered to put twin beds into my room so my daughter could stay there as well. A fantastic service in a very good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and warm atmosphere hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: mawerick81
Reviews.Content: I have stayed for a weekend in this hotel and was nicely surprised byt its warm atmosphere. Rooms nicely decorated and very calm. Reception staff very friendly, always happy to help. Very good location, situated in Latin quarter and very nice to walk around. The RER from the airport is direct, so it is very convenient. Surely will come back in the future.

Reviews.Title: “a very memorable first ever visit to paris”
Reviews.Author: deniseRadcliffe
Reviews.Content: Just back from a two night stay in paris with my husband for his 40th birthday. Stayed a this lovely hotel for two nights. Its very conveniently situated only 10 mins walk to the River Seine and Notre Dame. We were able to get around by foot all weekend and didnt have to get a taxi once. The staff at the hotel were lovely and so helpful, Oscar one of the receptionists took time out to mark on the map the best routes for us to take to see the sights of Paris, which was great. The room was lovely and extremly clean just what we needed. Breakfast was served until 11am so there was no need to rush in the morning. The waitress was so polite and friendly even when my husband set all the alarms off by burning his toast!!!!!!!!!!!! Would definately stay in this hotel again and would highly recommend for travellers looking for a small and personal feel in a hotel. Would also recommend Viator for your airport transfers, cost us £32 each way, they were on time for pickup and drop off in a very clean shuttle bus.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely quiet and clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: JamesH92
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Relais last week-end for a birthday treat in Paris. It was perfect - very clean and tidy, with friendly staff who were keen to help. It is well positioned for walking to the Quartier Latin and beyond, and is near the Luxembourg Gardens for some peace and quiet. Also 5 minutes from the Luxembourg RER station - we took the RER having given up on the taxi queue at the Gare du Nord.

Reviews.Title: “Shabby and not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: 423ShadyLane
Reviews.Content: Hotel lobby lovely but my room was pretty shabby with torn carpet that could definitely use a shampoo. This was by no ways a 4 star as it advertises. Beds are extremely uncomfortable (two twins pushed together) and bathroom is absolutely miniscule, even by Paris standards. Thin, rough towels could be used to exfoliate. Virtually no amenities, including hair conditioner. Moved out after two nights to a better location. Not worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “C'est super!”
Reviews.Author: DameDeBronze
Reviews.Content: My husband and I absolutely loved this hotel! Very charming, wonderful location, clean, and last but not least, the staff is absolutely fantastic! From the breakfast-room ladies to the front-desk, you can be sure you will be treated very politely, they are all very helpful, fun and very agreeable. The only thing that one could find not as great is the fact that there isn't a subway station closeby, but bus lines 21 and 27 are a much better, reliable way of moving around and seeing Paris at the same time. A+++!!!

Reviews.Title: “excellent service, very friendly staff, eager to help”
Reviews.Author: jmandak
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights and on the first morning I asked for lime for my tea, the waitress brought me a lemon, which is normal, but on the second morning when she saw me, she ran out to the market and bought me a lime! When and where has that ever happened before--anywhere in world?? The only bad thing I can say about it is that the rooms are small, but we got a great deal with breakfast, which is american style, and free internet, and I was very pleased! The 2 subway stops are not too far and the Luxembourg Gardens are close as well as markets and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: beenthereB4oz
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the hotel for 3 nights in September. The room was a normal size for a Paris hotel but not large by some international standards. The reception and breakfast room staff were very helpful. The hotel is convenient for restaurants, Luxembourg Gardens and Metro station. We enjoyed our stay. Ken & Chris, Australia

Reviews.Title: “A great Paris visit!”
Reviews.Author: wiggygail
Reviews.Content: We loved the hotel--only drawback is it is not as close to good metro lines as other places I have stayed. The rooms were large and comfy--very clean. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Easy walk to Notre Dame and Seine river--close bus lines nearby. Ave. Saint Michel very close with good restaurants, shops, bakeries, etc. Luxembourg Gardens within a short walk of the hotel. Dalloyau across from the Luxembourg Gardens has great quiche, coffee and pastries...lovely little place. Go out to eat at Le grand Colbert--very good food and nice atmosphere!!

Reviews.Title: “Outstandingly friendly hotel in the right location”
Reviews.Author: docframe
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel, comfortable base and genuinely helpful and lovely staff. Ideal for exploring Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Cute little hideaway”
Reviews.Author: Jeffnycus
Reviews.Content: We were lucky enough to discover this great neigbourhood and the cute Relais St Jacques. Close to major sites and transportation, well decorated decent size rooms, helpful staff makes you feel at home. We stayed in room # 502 with a lovely view on the Pantheon.

Reviews.Title: “What a find but oh; the price..”
Reviews.Author: daviesbagrie
Reviews.Content: First really excellent hotel we've found in Paris Having been to Paris several times over the last 3 years and stayed in a different hotel each time (always on the Rive Gauche side), we finally found a well-decorated, really good space bedroom with decent bathroom and some style! Unfortunately, it is a 4star & so , though we would love to return, from March onwards it rose steeply in price. However, when we visit Paris in winter, we are hoping for a reduction again. There is a small bar/coffee lounge at the entrance; don't buy anything if on a slight budget, as we paid 11 euros for a SMALL glass of wine & a coffee. Breakfast is not included. The receptionist, Sayma, was really great- helpful & smiling and we left our luggage until the time for the train home, which was handy. The only drawback is that it took 40 minutes to walk to the Notre Dame bridge but as always, it's a pleasure to walk in Paris. By the way, there is a great little cafe on the corner of a street nearby, where one can get fried eggs/baguette/jam/orange juice/coffee for 4 euros.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced Hotel”
Reviews.Author: EliteCTraveller
Reviews.Content: What you see is not quite what you get. We stayed 8 nights in a Prestige Deluxe Room on the top floor of this boutique hotel and were very disappointed with the quality and size of the room in comparison to the very high price we paid. Normally for a room at 289 Euro's a night, we have received much more. The room was very small (couldn't fit two suitcases), bathroom tiny, service was just average and staff were average. The only positive was the cleanliness of the room and the location was fairly central for our activities. The hotel is in a quiet location, but we would not stay here again unless the prices were more in line with the offering.

Reviews.Title: “I do not recommend this hotel, really do not fall into the pictures”
Reviews.Author: Falco21
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in mid August, Paris at its best! We made a reservation through Expedia and trusted the reviews both there and in Tripadvisor. The rooms are small, no pay TV other than regular french cable, super small bathroom. Beware of asking reception attendant to call a taxi......when the taxi arrives instead of starting off at 2.5 Euros, it already marks 8 Euros, for whatever reason that they do not clearly explain. Also I saw clearly when the Taxi driver gave money to the reception manager........really a disappointing detail. In reality this hotel is a 3 star hotel, that has been promoted recently to 4 stars.......it seems it barely passed or something. Many of the hotel literature laying around in the lobby still has the 3 star denomination. Nevertheless my Wife and I had a wonderful 3 night stay in Paris, because it is Paris, although I will never stay again here.

Reviews.Title: “parisian gem”
Reviews.Author: figlet3
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the hotel and it certainly never fails to make us want to return again and again. The location is excellent - quiet but just a short walk from the luxembourg gardens which is always bustling and great for people watching! The hotel staff are extemely helpful and friendly and speak great english. The rooms are decorated in excellent taste and are very clean and welcoming. The rooms may not be large but this is Paris for God's sake, get out of the room and see the city! Needless to say on our next trip to paris this is the only hotel we will consider staying in.

Reviews.Title: “Highly overpriced”
Reviews.Author: travelinoBonn
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel in good and quiet location, but rooms are very small despite being called double deluxe room. In addition, welcome drinks were not fresh but leftovers from the guests before. They were not replaced although we mentioned it. Prices are definitely much too high for that standard.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, but overpriced”
Reviews.Author: DivadelTeatro
Reviews.Content: Having looked on the website, we were looking forward to staying in this hotel, described on its website as "luxury left-bank Paris hotel". However, we were disappointed. Having paid extra for a deluxe room, we found there were no tea or coffee making facilities, despite the website stating that these would be present in the deluxe rooms. The room was small, but rooms in Paris are small and the bed in this particular room was huge, accounting for some of the lack of space. Having a 20 minute walk to Saint Michel station and the bustling streets which surround it, we certainly would not say that this hotel is "in the heart of the Latin Quarter", as its website claims. The staff did speak excellent English, but it became marginally annoying having to buzz for a receptionist to let us in when the hotel doors were locked before 11:30 every night. The room was nicely decorated, and there was plenty of hot water for the shower and bath, but we would definitely say that it was overpriced, even at the special internet rate which we paid.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful but cramped”
Reviews.Author: clhw
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely hotel. A great location near the Luxembourg gardens, very quiet considering the location, and nicely decorated and maintained. All in all a classy place. But we felt it was not good value for money as although we had paid extra for a superior room our room was absolutely tiny, even by Parisian standards. (I know that travellers from North America often find European rooms small, but believe me, even by European standards, this was really small) It was up on the top floor so perhaps ones below would have been bigger, but then perhaps it would be better not to designate such rooms as superior, as we were left wondering what we would have got had we not upgraded! It was OK for a night, but if you were staying there for longer it would have been somewhat claustrophobic, not to mention inconvenient as with 2 people in it, you almost could not avoid bumping into each other.

Reviews.Title: “CRAMPED”
Reviews.Author: searcher008
Reviews.Content: This hotel is small and cramped,the room we had was so small we had to put the suitcases outside the room until a bigger room could be found,very well furnished and well looked after except for the luggage marks on walls where people have tried to get there luggage into the room,very cramped hallways and very small lift,staff so-so even a little off hand,booked a smoking room but on arrival was told it was a non smoking hotel but in the brochure stated it had both smoking and non smoking. I'm surprised by the amount of people who seemed shocked to find that you can get hot water in a hotel are they also shocked to find that they have electricity.These things do come as standard in any class of hotel........ Overall not a bad hotel just very small.

Reviews.Title: “Fab weekend in a fab City”
Reviews.Author: scott_ccs
Reviews.Content: The hotel is excellent in a quiet location not far from the centre of the latin quarter. We stayed in room 402 for three nights from the 19th January 2008. The room was lovely and one of the cleanest and quietest we have ever stayed in. The room itself is not that large and the bathroom is very small. However there was plenty of hot water with clean towels and room service everyday. There is a TV in the room with CNN and BBC World Service and located beneath the tv cabinet was the safe which is free and the minibar which is reasonably priced for a Paris Hotel. We did not have breakfast in the hotel because it costs 18 euors extra. The staff at the hotel are excellent and speak perfect English, there is someone at the desk 24 hours a day, and they are very knowledgeable of what to see and where to go in Paris. We chose the hotel because of the previous good reviews on trip advisor and the location. From leaving the airport at Charles De Gaulle, we caught the RER B train which takes you to the Luxembourg Station. This route is direct and you do not need to change trains and the cost is 8 euros each way. You walk out from the underground Luxembourg station following the Exit sign (sortie) for Rue De l'Abee. When you arrive at ground level walk on for about 15 metres turn left and walk for about another 150 metres and the hotel is on your right hand side. Next to the hotel is a restaurant and cafe and not much else. We walked down to St Michel Place which takes about ten minutes (or you can catch the RER B train from Luxembourg Station to St. Michel Place) that's where the lively nightlife of the latin quarter is situated. We ate in restaurants which had dinner for 15 euros for a choice of three courses and the bars have a happy hour between 18.00 and 21.00 hours or you could grab a gyro (greek kebab) for about five euros. Drinks were about 8 euros for a pint of larger and between 15 - 20 euros for a bottle of wine. This area of Paris I would recommend for its lively and friendly atmosphere and good value for money in what is possibly the worlds most expensive city. We found the best way to see the City is the open top bus tour which is 28 euros for a 2 day ticket and we also used the metro and RER where you can buy 10 tickets for 10 euros (this is called a carnet). Fab weekend, when we go back to Paris we will be looking to stay at this hotel again - Loved It!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, lovely rooms, clean, clean, clean!”
Reviews.Author: mscapehorn
Reviews.Content: THis is a very quaint, typically European hotel located on a quiet street within the university area of Paris. The staff at this hotel was wonderful; very helpful and very friendly. The rooms are decorated with very nice antique furniture and quality draperies and very comfortable linens. The rooms were immaculate and were kept clean, clean, clean during our stay. (Towels could have been softer, but makeup pads were a great touch.) We had two adjoining rooms, one for our daughters (in their 20's) and one for my husband and me. Our room had a lovely balcony, but their were no chairs or table to sit and enjoy a drink. The rooms had ample storage space both with bureaus and closets and safes. The bathrooms were very good size for Europe, with very workable showers and hair dryers. The lounge downstairs was like a small living room in your own home and was delightful to sit and enjoy champagne together after an evening out. The hotel did not accommodate our early arrival, which was disappointing after an overnight flight from the States. You have to walk at least 10 min. or take a train to get to most sights. The hotel is a bit off the beaten path, but it was quiet and there were a couple of good restaurants and bakeries w/i a minute or two walk..(We do not recommend the restaurant next door.) The staff was outstanding and did all they could to be cordial and helpful. I would stay at this hotel again gladly, but it was not really in a convenient location for us. I recommend it highly, but bring plenty of cab fare to make it easier to get to places.

Reviews.Title: “Staff is the standout at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: hilltopwatch
Reviews.Content: After reading numerous reviews of small luxury hotels in Paris, I selected the Hotel Relais Saint-Jacques for a one night stay on the first day of my vacation in France. An early check-in, which I had requested at the time of booking, was not available. There is a small breakfast area with tiny furniture and a small bar/living room that, when I arrived, was completely occupied by a single family. After an overnight flight from the States, having a comfortable place to wait is a definite plus and this hotel was short on that measure. My room was small, even for Paris, but comfortable, well-equipped and nicely decorated. The breakfast was just adequate for the class of hotel and price charged. The real plus of this hotel is its staff, who were friendly, welcoming and very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “a very civilised hotel”
Reviews.Author: eurotrippers
Reviews.Content: This was a much better hotel than others in which we have stayed in Paris. It is situated in a quiet street, but with many restaurants nearby. Breakfast was pricy, but was included in our booking and was of high quality with fresh grapefruit juice and croissants. The room and bed were very comfortable and the staff were very friendly. The rooms were individually furnished with "period-like" items and it felt really civilised to take tea in the bar area surrounded by Louis XV objets d'art. The hotel had a real quality and ambience and I would happily have stayed for more than the one night that we had booked.

Reviews.Title: “It was okay”
Reviews.Author: LuWeezy
Reviews.Content: Great showers, beds. Rooms small and clean. But 5Euro each morning for a cup of coffee??? That was an unexpected charge. Staff very pleasant and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great service from all staff, and best coffee I have ever had...”
Reviews.Author: ferrettfish
Reviews.Content: Just returned from relas saint-Jaques, what a wonderful stay. The service made this hotel worth its 4 stars..though rooms are small, even though we were upgrade to deluxe room, this is standard for all parisan hotels. Helpful, cheeful staff even down to maid serivce. Would recommend this hotel to anyone, as long as you dont mind walking at bit to get to st michel, st germain de pres or montparnase districts. The hotel is direct from charles de galle on rer which is just around the corner, but there is not a metro close. So bring walking shoes! All in all great service from staff and during breakfast I had the best coffee I ever had!!!. Dont expect much from the hot items but continental was delicious..

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, very comfortable”
Reviews.Author: posterguru
Reviews.Content: I was in Paris for Business, I selected the hotel due to the response on trip advisor. Very clean comfortable rooms, beds were average, bathroom was very clean, staff was very helpful. I will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Relais Saint Jacques”
Reviews.Author: paris_1204
Reviews.Content: had my eye on this hotel for a few years now. I just didn't commit as I had no idea about it except for Tripadvisor.com reviews. Since I noticed that TA had recent favorable reviews I decided to take a chance and book a room for my summer visit. Luckily my visit coincided with a summer special the hotel runs yearly. I was lucky to get a room with a Pantheon view including full breakfast for 140 euro. Standard rates are between 160 to 200+ euro. I knew that the hotel was not located next to the Seine, but it was a good choice nonetheless. It's a few blocks from the always busy Blvd. St. Michel and the Luxembourg Gardens. It takes about 15 minutes to walk down to the Seine. Upon entering the hotel the reception desk is just that, a desk. To its right is the sitting room/bar where the decor is classical French. The breakfast room is down the hall and the elevator can hold four people easily so it's not coffin size as usual. When you enter your floor you will notice piped in music playing in the foyer. The Prestige rooms are wonderful. They are a bit larger than the standard rooms but are smaller than the suite. Ask for a room that has a Pantheon view. I got room #403 that had a nice view of the dome and of rue Gay Lussac. Besides the view the rooms are decorated with nice antiques. It's simple and there is no toile involved thank God. If you like French classical style decor then you will appreciate the furnishings. Also the bathrooms are complete in rust colored marble countertops that are so spacious it's sinful. There are generous supplies of bath gel, shampoo, and the requisite shower caps, shoe shine sponge, sewing kit, Q-tips, and makeup remover pads. BTW, the Relais Saint Jacques' bathrooms have 'real' hairdryers and not the 'vacuum cleaner' types which are nothing more than a hose that blows out hot air! The breafast is not included unless you got a summer special like me. In that case you're entitled to either a complimentary American buffet breakfast or a continental breakfast in the room. It's a fair spread at the buffet: boiled eggs, cold cuts, cereals, fresh fruits, viennoiseries, baguettes, fried eggs, sausages, yogurt, orange juice, tea, and coffee or hot chocolate. Also this is the only hotel that I've stayed in Paris that if you request it, you can check out at 1 p.m. The staff is polite and approachable, not overly friendly except for Sayma who will chat with you about anything. It was the time just after the London bombings, and as luck had it the day after I arrived there was another set of bombings. Sayma and I talked of it as I had to travel by train and was a bit apprehensive. I received the hotel's excellent summer rate special as I visited Paris in July, one of the low season months. The Prestige room wtih Pantheon view was 140 euro including either American buffet or continental breakfast. Normal rates for this particular type of room is 235 euro with the breakfast charge being 17 euro! Note: There is a well-regarded restaurant, Le Mauzac, located next door to the hotel. Also you can order room service from its menu.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous St. Jacques”
Reviews.Author: lpavlovi
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have stayed at the St Jacques four separate times with the most recent being this November. We found that it not only was as good as our first visit in the 1990's but that it continues to maintain the highest standards in all areas. The rooms are spotless as are the common areas. The staff is professional, friendly, and always helpful. It is a complete joy to return to Paris and the St Jacques so much so that we have now visited Paris 6 plus times and only stayed elsewhere when the St Jacques was not available. If you like to have breakfast at the hotel, the one at the St Jacques will accommodate all appetites from American eggs, potatoes, ham to cereal, rolls cheese....even if you must pay additional to enjoy this fine morning treat. We shall always stay at the St Jacques should we be fortunate to return to Paris once again. Lorraine and Bob, California

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay in a nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: lara57
Reviews.Content: Thank you very much for the great hospitality; we really had a lovely time! We love Paris, every time we come back we feel new emotions. And the Relais Saint Jacques is our favorite hotel : We love the location and also sitting down in the evening on the comfortable chairs with a hot cup of verveine and reading the charming books. We will be back soon ! A bientot, L.BENSON

Reviews.Title: “Over priced”
Reviews.Author: haggisgardner
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well located quiet and peaceful and the staff are very friendly and helpful however for the price and appointed 4 star standard of the hotel it is hugely disappointing. The hotel is no more than small rooms off a narrow stairwell and small lift. The lounge/bar on ground floor is a fraction of the size denoted on websites and is usually unstaffed. The rooms are tired and the quality of linen and towels poor given the 4-star rating. This hotel would be a good 3-star if the prices reflected that rating, but given the cost and the expectation presented through the quality rating it fails to deliver and you are left feeling hard done by upon paying and departing. this is sad as overall if the hotel was rated appropriately it would be worth a stay with a good location in terms of accessibility to the metro, to bars, cafes and bistro's and importantly the superb shopping locations of St Germain de Pres etc.

Reviews.Title: “Very sweet but very quiet”
Reviews.Author: Peagreen98
Reviews.Content: Service was lovely and the hotel room very sweet but the hotel is in a very quiet location and its bar area isn't really made for lounging in. We did have a lovely stay there but had to keep heading to the RER to find nice places to relax - the area around the hotel was deserted (although this is common in Paris in August). The room had a lovely view of the street and the top of the Pantheon and as usual in Paris the bathrooms were extremely small - barely room to brush your teeth! The front desk staff were very helpful but head out for breakfast rather than having it here.

Reviews.Title: “perfect for couples”
Reviews.Author: Solange72
Reviews.Content: Great accomodations for a couple or a couple plus one baby. Great location, friendly faces at the reception, comfortable and cozy.

Reviews.Title: “Great small hotel.”
Reviews.Author: oztravellerAustralia
Reviews.Content: Only spent one night at the St Jacques, but we hope to return for a longer stay. If you are looking for a small, comfortable Paris Hotel, well situated at a reasonable price, this is the place. A short luggage trundle from the Luxembourg RER station on the line from C.de Gaulle airport, yes there is a lift from memory, takes you to the delightful tree lined, quiet street where the St Jacques is situted. Very helpful reception, stylish decore, comfortable room with a view, all were welcome after a 16 hour flight. Room small but hey this is Paris and at 170 euros per night we were more than happy. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location ~ quaint & comfortable”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Spent five days at the Relais Saint-Jacques in March and we were very pleased with this hotel. The location was fantastic ~ a very short walk to Luxembourg Gardens. The entire hotel staff was excellent and the rooms were very cozy and charming. We highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but a few let downs”
Reviews.Author: Riomaravilha
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a week in Paris. Overall, I liked the Relais Saint Jacques, but there were a few things that I wasn´t aware of even after doing tons of searching. So here goes: Pros: 1. Staff - Extremely kind, helpful English-speaking (if necessary) staff. 2. Environment - Cute hotel, clean and, contrary to what a previous reviewer said, the furnishings in our room and in the hotel overall were not outdated. I found they were appropriate for the design of the building and created a cozy atmosphere. 3. Location - Great location, near the Luxemborg Gardens and Notre Dame. 4. Very clean - There were always clean towels, the bed was made and the room was kept very tidy. A+ Cons: 1. No free Wi-fi access - There is no free Wi-fi access in all rooms - even though it is listed as a feature on many sites. This was essential in my decision and I was really let down. When " Wi-fi access in all rooms" is written on a site, it doesn´t always mean free, but on the site through which I made the reservation (and many others), it said free. However, when I got there, I was told that access was 5 Euros per half hour - absurd! At the Internet cafe nearby it was 80 cents per hour. Next time I will send an e-mail and confirm that it is free. 2. Breakfast too expensive - I think breakfast is 18 Euros per person, better to go to a nearby bakery and get something. 3. Phones don´t seem to work properly - I tried to call a few places within Paris and didn´t get through using the hotel phone, however managed to on my mobile phone. Also, you could only place collect international calls. 4. Small room - I liked our room very much. However, it should be known that ours was a Standard Prestige and two people couldn´t fit in the bathroom at the same time unless one was in the shower. If you have lots of luggage or are a larger person, be warned.

Reviews.Title: “great welcome”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Spent two nights in this hotel. Position wonderful, quiet tree lined street, Luxemburg gardens nearby, staff warm, welcoming and efficient. Very good arrangement of excursions. Would highly recommend to those seeking the benefits of a small hotel with the expected efficiency of a large one.

Reviews.Title: “Great surprise”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife & i just returned to the States after a wonderfull vacation in paris, at the hotel relais saint jacques. We had a truly magical time, a realy unforgattable experience. The hotel is quiet and non smoking, well located in the latin quarter, within walking distance to everything (subway, bus, museums,restaurants,shops, jazz clubs...) We stayed in they deluxe room 502, with balcony and a great view. The room is lovely, comfortable and fine in every way. House keeping is impeccable. The staff is professional, friendly, more than helpful. From check-in to check-out, our stay was perfect. We still think this is one of the better hotels in Paris. We would definitely stay again. Highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in the Latin Quarter”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel in mid-December. Although our room was a little small, it was very well appointed and the bathroom was great. The staff were a delight, spoke excellent English and were happy to accomodate our requests for restaurant reservations and the like. There is an excellent bistro next door (Le Mauzac) which is worth trying. The hotel is in the Latin quarter, a short walk from the Luxembourg gardens, and the RER train station. We were able to walk easily to Notre Dame, St. Chapelle and the Louvre. Note that breakfast is not included in the room rate. The breakfast buffet was perfectly fine, but very over-priced. My recommendation would be to pick up a croissant and coffee elsewhere. Apart from this, a great hotel which we would happily return to.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel was advertised as a 4-star but had the standard of a 2 to 3 star hotel. My wife and I were disappointed at the size of the room and the dated furnishings. The bed cover was faded and there was a hole in the bed sheet. The room was in dire need of a new bed which suffered from large sags on both sides. At 200 euros per night, it simply is not good value. The room and the bathroom were both tiny.

Reviews.Title: “Petite room”
Reviews.Author: ReneeWindsor_ON
Reviews.Content: Room was ridiculously small. Not enough room for luggage. Overlooked a wall. Definitely not worth 200euro/night or the equivalent 250USD per night. Stayed for 3 nights. Smallest hotel room I have ever stayed in...even by European standards.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous, very cute hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: 5 days in Paris @ Relais Saint Jacques hotel is unforgettable. Paris is magic and this hotel made it more wonderful. This hotel is gorgeous, very cute. We had a Deluxe room on the 5th floor, with balcony and a nice view to the Pantheon. Oh! The bedroom is very pretty…The staff, extremely helpful and always there to give directions and fabulous restaurant suggestions. We really enjoyed our stay and would love to stay for longer! If you are looking for a convenient, well appointed hotel in Paris, we recommend this charming hotel. "---"

HotelInfo.Name: Relais Saint-Jacques
HotelInfo.Address: 3 Rue de l'Abbe de l'Epee, 75005 Paris, France
